SENT.plain: Fifty-four atheromatous plaques of carotid arteries, obtained at autopsy, were scanned with a high-resolution real-time instrument, then histologically examined
Comparison between atherogenesis assessed first by histology then by ultrasonography allowed us to differentiate young from old plaques
An old plaque is characterized by a dense heterogeneous echo pattern and irregular borders or ulceration
Previous studies have shown a correlation between the presence of hemorrhage and ulceration of atheromatous plaques in the carotid, and the frequency of cerebral complications
Since these characteristics were mainly found in older plaques, we consider them to be the most important ones clinically
